description: Construction of a three-storey dwellinghouse incorporating basement, front lightwell and rear courtyard; provision of associated amenity space, cycle parking and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 19-011-E01 (existing OS plan); 19-011-E02 (existing ground floor plan); 19-011-E03 (existing street elevation, Richmond Road); 19-011-E04 (existing front elevation, east facing); 19-011-E05 (existing rear elevation, west facing); 19-011-E06 (existing side elevation, south facing); 19-011-P01 (proposed OS plan); 19-011-P02 (proposed site-ground floor plan); 19-011-P03 (proposed basement plan); 19-011-P04 (proposed first floor plan); 19-011-P05 (proposed second floor plan); 19-011-P06 (proposed roof plan); 19-011-P07 (proposed street elevation, Richmond Road); 19-011-P08 (proposed front elevation, east facing); 19-011-P09 (proposed rear elevation, west facing); 19-011-P10 (proposed side elevation, south facing);
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order), at no time shall the units be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The redundant crossover to the site shall be reinstated to pavement prior to occupation of the development. Such re-instatement shall be implemented by the Council at the applicant's expense prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, and in the interests of living conditions of adjoining occupiers and future occupiers of the development hereby permitted in accordance with London Plan policy 6.10, Development Strategy policies 1.1(g) and 1.2(f).

| A metal grille shall be fixed to the front lightwell and shall be retained thereafter. The flank wall windows shall contain obscure glazing and shall be fixed shut for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: For safety and to harmonise with the surroundings and to protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | Prior to completion of the development hereby approved, the proposed  planting to the front a rear of the development and the green roof shall be implemented and shall include varied species of vegetation to encourage biodiversity. Any planting to the approved layout that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason:  To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity and biodiversity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development  in accordance with policies 5.10, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 and of the London Plan (2016), the London Environment strategy (2018) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| A detailed construction method statement (including the construction of the basement) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced. The statement shall include details of phasing and programming, removal of earth from site; construction methods; site management and access; vehicle and machinery specifications and numbers/frequency of vehicles/deliveries, construction worker parking, anticipated number, delivery times, dust suppression measures, site security, vehicle manoeuvring and turning, locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices, procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, measures to ensure the construction process does not effect of neighbouring highways, details of wheel water spraying facilities and noise/vibration mitigation measures. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.13, 7.14 and 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Prior to occupation of the development, a discreet timber-screened storage area to accommodate bins for recyclable and non-recyclable waste in accordance with the Council's waste guidlines and BS 5906:2005 shall be provided within the forecourt of the scheme hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of appearance and setting for the development and to ensure that the proposed development enhances the visual amenity of the locality, in the interests of the amenities of the occupants of the development in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013) | At least two (2) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site. Such provision shall be brought to use prior to the occupation of the development and retained thereafter.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2016) policy 6.9 and table 6.3
